page.title: 01Ludgershall downland
page.content: On th eastern margin of Salisbury Plain our areais of open chalk downlad, mixed woodland (part of Collinbourne forest) and one main settlement, Ludgershall, populatin around 3,000. The land, average elevatioon 125m, slopes down from the noth and west towards Ludgershall. There is little surface drainage, only a short section of the R.Bourne in the N.W.; most drainage is underground following the dry valleys. Major land use is both arable and pastural farming, the woodland, Ludgershalll itself, and MOD land, especially the vehicle maineance depot and the medical supplies depot; both of which lie to the wst o the village. Army training routes also criss-cross the area. Three main roads (3026,A346,A342) result in a considerable amount of traffic passing
